docs.label_endnote:
%0 Conference Proceedings
%T Making Gabor Noise Fast and Normalized
%+ Models and Algorithms for Visualization and Rendering (MAVERICK )
%A Tavernier, Vincent
%A Neyret, Fabrice
%A Vergne, Romain
%A Thollot, Joëlle
%< avec comité de lecture
%B Eurographics 2019 - 40th Annual Conference of the European Association for Computer Graphics
%C Gênes, Italy
%Y The Eurographics Association
%3 Eurographics 2019 - Short Papers
%P 37-40
%8 2019-05-06
%D 2019
%R 10.2312/egs.20191009
%K textures
%K noise
%K procedural
%K Gabor
%Z Computer Science [cs]
%Z Computer Science [cs]/Graphics [cs.GR]Conference papers
%X Gabor Noise is a powerful procedural texture synthesis technique, but it has two major drawbacks: It is costly due to the high required splat density and not always predictable because properties of instances can differ from those of the process. We bench performance and quality using alternatives for each Gabor Noise ingredient: point distribution, kernel weighting and kernel shape. For this, we introduce 3 objective criteria to measure process convergence, process stationarity, and instance stationarity. We show that minor implementation changes allow for 17-24x speed-up with same or better quality.
%G English
%2 https://hal.inria.fr/hal-02104389/document
%2 https://hal.inria.fr/hal-02104389/file/short1034_CRC.pdf
%L hal-02104389
%U https://hal.inria.fr/hal-02104389
%~ UGA
%~ CNRS
%~ INRIA
%~ INPG

%~ INRIA_TEST

%~ LJK_GI_MAVERICK

%~ INRIA2
%~ INRIA-RENGRE

en_title_s: Making Gabor Noise Fast and Normalized
title_s: Making Gabor Noise Fast and Normalized
abstract_s: Gabor Noise is a powerful procedural texture synthesis technique, but it has two major drawbacks: It is costly due to the high required splat density and not always predictable because properties of instances can differ from those of the process. We bench performance and quality using alternatives for each Gabor Noise ingredient: point distribution, kernel weighting and kernel shape. For this, we introduce 3 objective criteria to measure process convergence, process stationarity, and instance stationarity. We show that minor implementation changes allow for 17-24x speed-up with same or better quality.
en_abstract_s: Gabor Noise is a powerful procedural texture synthesis technique, but it has two major drawbacks: It is costly due to the high required splat density and not always predictable because properties of instances can differ from those of the process. We bench performance and quality using alternatives for each Gabor Noise ingredient: point distribution, kernel weighting and kernel shape. For this, we introduce 3 objective criteria to measure process convergence, process stationarity, and instance stationarity. We show that minor implementation changes allow for 17-24x speed-up with same or better quality.

 Making Gabor Noise Fast and Normalized Vincent Tavernier 9af82af4f47008b75d2501046d371f85 inria.fr vincent-tavernier 742166 42291-742166 Fabrice Neyret 1291441a2221e6238a2fcb661b4da49f inria.fr fabrice-neyret 20288 25095-20288 https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0777-2401 https://www.idref.fr/057467021 Romain Vergne 6d470daed577dfdb54f9ae64df284635 inria.fr romain-vergne 752416 20242-752416 https://www.idref.fr/151461090 Joëlle Thollot 21c936c3ca3fa354f0fd98c76017c340 inria.fr joelle-thollot 15326 8227-15326 https://www.idref.fr/05653471X Vincent TAVERNIER 9af82af4f47008b75d2501046d371f85 inria.fr 2019-04-19 14:49:53 2019-02-27 2022-02-08 09:10:02 2019-04-23 10:35:36 2019-05-06 2019-04-19 contributor Vincent TAVERNIER 9af82af4f47008b75d2501046d371f85 inria.fr CCSD hal-02104389 https://hal.inria.fr/hal-02104389 tavernier:hal-02104389 <i>Eurographics 2019 - 40th Annual Conference of the European Association for Computer Graphics</i>, May 2019, Gênes, Italy. pp.37-40, <a target="_blank" href="https://dx.doi.org/10.2312/egs.20191009">⟨10.2312/egs.20191009⟩</a> Eurographics 2019 - 40th Annual Conference of the European Association for Computer Graphics, May 2019, Gênes, Italy. pp.37-40, ⟨10.2312/egs.20191009⟩ HAL Grenoble Alpes CNRS - Centre national de la recherche scientifique INRIA - Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et en Automatique Institut polytechnique de Grenoble INRIA Grenoble - Rhône-Alpes INRIA - Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et en Automatique Laboratoire Jean Kuntzmann Département Géométrie et Images MAVERICK TESTALAIN1 INRIA 2 INRIA-RENGRE Université Grenoble Alpes [2016-2019] International No No Yes Yes Making Gabor Noise Fast and Normalized Vincent Tavernier 9af82af4f47008b75d2501046d371f85 inria.fr vincent-tavernier 742166 42291-742166 Fabrice Neyret 1291441a2221e6238a2fcb661b4da49f inria.fr fabrice-neyret 20288 25095-20288 https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0777-2401 https://www.idref.fr/057467021 Romain Vergne 6d470daed577dfdb54f9ae64df284635 inria.fr romain-vergne 752416 20242-752416 https://www.idref.fr/151461090 Joëlle Thollot 21c936c3ca3fa354f0fd98c76017c340 inria.fr joelle-thollot 15326 8227-15326 https://www.idref.fr/05653471X Eurographics 2019 - 40th Annual Conference of the European Association for Computer Graphics 2019-05-06 2019-05-10 Gênes Italy The Eurographics Association Eurographics 2019 - Short Papers 37-40 2019 10.2312/egs.20191009 English textures noise procedural Gabor Computer Science [cs] Computer Science [cs]/Graphics [cs.GR] Conference papers

Gabor Noise is a powerful procedural texture synthesis technique, but it has two major drawbacks: It is costly due to the high required splat density and not always predictable because properties of instances can differ from those of the process. We bench performance and quality using alternatives for each Gabor Noise ingredient: point distribution, kernel weighting and kernel shape. For this, we introduce 3 objective criteria to measure process convergence, process stationarity, and instance stationarity. We show that minor implementation changes allow for 17-24x speed-up with same or better quality.
